title: Ludovic Boi
data: Ludovic Boi (born 27 March 1989) is a Mauritian footballer who plays in the Football West State League for Floreat Athena.[1][2][3][4][5] Boi began playing football in Mauritius for Racing Club before moving with his family to Australia in 2001.[6] Ludovic started out his professional career with Stirling Lions. After that, he signed on for the inaugural Perth Glory youth squad, featuring prominently. On 1 November 2009 he made his senior debut for Perth Glory as a substitute against Melbourne Victory.[7] In 2010, he rejoined Stirling Lions. In 2012, he joined Floreat Athena, captaining them for a period of time. Over a decade later, he is still playing there. (Correct as of 20 April 2010) Personal honours This biographical article related to a soccer midfielder from Australia is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
